question: Inferior rib notching is seen in -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Coarctation of aorta Rib notchingo "Rib notches" are peripheral, sharply circumscribed osteolytic lesion on superior or inferior surface of ribs, o Causes of rib notching ae: -Inferior surface. Arterial. Coarctation of aorta. Bilateral Rib notching is seen on the lower border of 3rd to 8th ribs. Rib notching is absent in the 1st & 2nd ribs. Rib notching is usually present after the age of 7 years. Aortic thrombosis (aortic obstruction) or aortitis. Subclavian obstruction after Blalock operation for Fallot's tetralogy (Taussig Blalock operation. Pulmonary oligemia. Pulmonary' atresia, TOF, absent pulmonary artery. Venous: - SVC obstruction. Arteriovenous: - Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation, chest wall arteriovenous malformation. Neurogenic: - Neurofibromatosis. Superior surface. Connective tissue diseases: - SLE, Scleroderma, RA, Sjogren's syndrome. Metabolic: - Hyperparathyroidism. Miscellaneous: Neurofibromatosis, Restrictive lung disease, Poliomyelitis, Marfan's syndrome, progeria. Osteogenesis imperfecta.

question: Best investigation for diagnosing abdominal aortic aneurysm is?
exp: Ans. (b) CT angiography. Ref. Interventional cardiology by sinha, p 134, Harrison's 17/e, chapter 242
